CatDescriptText: Mrs. Gladys Lee, 3140 Cordell Place, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 4, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that Sherman Adams was guilty of misconduct in office of assistant to the President? Do you think that he should have resigned?" answer reads: "It is hard to say whether or not he was guilty or not guilty of misconduct in office.  I don't think that he should have resigned, because it made him look guilty  and also made everything that they said about him seem true."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Gladys Lee wearing light colored check suit, standing with crossed arms in front of trolley, Liberty Photo Shop in background, Wood Street, Downtown
